oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 30 d.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 30 d. Newspaper clipping: The Really Vital Question. Nashville Banner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Really Vital Question. It is not a question of "will, we get it?" but of "what will we do with it when we do get it?'" So, unless something should happen to turn back the wheels of national evolution, we had better begin to study the great science of statescraft, so as to be able to make intelligent use of the privileges of the ballot. And incidentally, some ingenuous woman might turn her attention towards devising a suitable costume in which the sex could appear at "these dreadful polls" more modestly than some of them appear at church or on the streets during the present prevailing modes. Nashville Banner.
